text: Using a functional RNAi kinase screen , recent study identified epidermal growth factor receptor ( EGFR ) and ephrin receptor A2 ( EPHA2 ) , two receptor tyrosine kinases ( RTKs ) which regulate a number of key cellular functions , as host factors for HCV entry [ 103 ] . The results showed that the identified RTKs mediated HCV entry by regulating CD81claudin - 1 coreceptor associations and viral glycoproteindependent membrane fusion , implying that inhibition of RTK function may constitute a new approach for the prevention and treatment of HCV infection .
